reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Thematic contribution to the World Health Organization (WHO)

description.narrative:
Finland contributes one million euros to the World Health Organization's Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan in order to support efforts to response to the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in developing countries. The objective is to restrain the fur ther spread of Coronavirus in developing countries and to scale up the country readiness and response operations in countries with weaker capacity to identify diagnose and treat cases. The World Health Organization has estimated that resources required glo
bally from 1 February to 30 April 2020 will be about 6757 million USD.

Suomi myontaa miljoona euroa Maailman terveysjarjestolle Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan ?suunnitelman tukemiseksi koronavirusepidemian (COVID-19) vastaisessa tyossa kehitysmaissa. Tavoitteena on hidastaa viruksen leviamista kehitysmaissa ja vahvi staa maita joilla on heikompi kapasiteetti viruksen havaitsemisessa henkiloiden testaamisessa seka sairastuneiden hoitamisessa ja heidan eristamisessaan. Maailman terveysjarjesto on arvioinut globaalin rahoitustarpeen ajalle 1.2.-30.4.2020 olevan noin 6757
miljoonaa Yhdysvaltain dollaria.
